meanings.definition: To insure (something) for an amount greater than its actual value.
meanings.sent1: She made the mistake of overinsuring her car, paying more than necessary for coverage.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overinsure your belongings to avoid unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: John realized he was overinsuring his phone when he paid a high premium for a cheap device.
meanings.sent4: By overinsuring her jewelry, Sarah was essentially throwing money away on excessive protection.
meanings.sent5: Overinsuring your house can lead to wasted money if you never need to make a claim.
